input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Unobserved confounders has a direct effect on education level and salary. Proximity to a college has a direct effect on education level. Education level has a direct effect on salary. Unobserved confounders is unobserved. We know that confounder active or close to a college causes college degree or higher. confounder active or college degree or higher causes high salary. We observed the person lives far from a college and confounder active. Would the employee has a low salary if high school degree or lower instead of college degree or higher?
